neighbors.name: Dexter and Patricia McCormick
neighbors.claims: Dexter A. McCormick and M. Patricia McCormick established a private family foundation in 2019 based in Zionsville, Indiana ([projects.propublica.org](https://projects.propublica.org/nonprofits/organizations/814641427#:~:text=Dexter%20A%20And%20M%20Patricia,Mccormick%20Family%20Foundation%20Inc)) and both serve as its trustees ([projects.propublica.org](https://projects.propublica.org/nonprofits/organizations/814641427#:~:text=Dexter%20A%20Mccormick%20,%240)), reflecting substantial assets and philanthropy. They own multiple parcels of land in Onekama Township (as indicated by county property records) but maintain their primary residence outside Michigan ([projects.propublica.org](https://projects.propublica.org/nonprofits/organizations/814641427#:~:text=Dexter%20A%20And%20M%20Patricia,Mccormick%20Family%20Foundation%20Inc)). No public statements or involvement by the McCormicks in local development discussions could be found in available records ([www.manisteenews.com](https://www.manisteenews.com/news/article/Onekama-Township-Board-approves-consent-judgment-17011246.php#:~:text=ONEKAMA%20TWP,Point%20Drive%20property%20in%20Onekama)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Initiate contact through a personalized outreach highlighting community benefits. Emphasize how the project can align with local community improvements and maintain property values, appealing to their broader philanthropic perspective and interest in community well-being.

neighbors.name: Christine A. Melling
neighbors.claims: Manistee County property records list Christine A. Melling as the owner of three parcels in Onekama Township ([maps.liaa.org](https://maps.liaa.org/manisteeparcels/default.asp#:~:text=Manistee%20County%20Property%20Search%20,the%20Manistee%20County%20Home%20page)). She has no presence in local news archives or township minutes — no public statements or civic roles are documented under her name as of the latest searches ([www.manisteenews.com](https://www.manisteenews.com/news/article/Onekama-Township-Board-approves-consent-judgment-17011246.php#:~:text=ONEKAMA%20TWP,Point%20Drive%20property%20in%20Onekama)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach Ms. Melling in person or via a trusted community introduction to build rapport. Provide clear information about the project and listen to any concerns she may have, assuring that her property’s use and quiet rural lifestyle will be respected.

neighbors.name: Peter and Sarah Armstrong
neighbors.claims: Peter and Sarah Armstrong own a residential parcel in Onekama Township (per county parcel records) ([maps.liaa.org](https://maps.liaa.org/manisteeparcels/default.asp#:~:text=Manistee%20County%20Property%20Search%20,the%20Manistee%20County%20Home%20page)). They do not appear in any Onekama community meeting notes or local news reports — the surname surfaces only in unrelated contexts (e.g., a school coach) and not in development matters ([www.manisteenews.com](https://www.manisteenews.com/sports/article/Armstrong-hired-as-new-head-coach-of-Onekama-14223716.php#:~:text=team%20www.manisteenews.com%20%20Sports%20,to%20hit%20the%20ground%20running)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage the Armstrongs with a friendly, informal meeting or phone call. Share information about the development’s plans and impacts, and invite their questions, demonstrating respect for their perspective and addressing any practical concerns (traffic, noise, etc.) they might have.

neighbors.name: Daniel and Alfreda Korona
neighbors.claims: Daniel and Alfreda Korona are listed as owners of two adjacent parcels in Onekama Township ([maps.liaa.org](https://maps.liaa.org/manisteeparcels/default.asp#:~:text=Manistee%20County%20Property%20Search%20,the%20Manistee%20County%20Home%20page)). There is no record of the Koronas participating in local government meetings or voicing opinions on land use in media sources; they have remained outside public view regarding development issues (no mentions found in township minutes or news) ([www.manisteenews.com](https://www.manisteenews.com/news/article/Onekama-Township-Board-approves-consent-judgment-17011246.php#:~:text=ONEKAMA%20TWP,Point%20Drive%20property%20in%20Onekama)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Reach out to the Koronas through a personal visit or local referral, acknowledging their long-term stake in the land. Emphasize that the project will not disrupt their farming or property usage and address any questions about infrastructure (like drainage or road access) proactively.

neighbors.name: Thomas and Marguerite Slovik
neighbors.claims: Thomas Slovik (born 1957) was a Onekama-area landowner who passed away in 2020 ([www.legacy.com](https://www.legacy.com/us/obituaries/limaohio/name/thomas-slovik-obituary?id=8199944#:~:text=Thomas%20Slovik%20Obituary%20%281957%20,Manistee)). His wife, Marguerite Slovik, is the surviving partner and current title holder of their parcel, but she has not been publicly involved in township meetings or debates on local developments (no references to her in available records) ([www.manisteenews.com](https://www.manisteenews.com/news/article/Onekama-Township-Board-approves-consent-judgment-17011246.php#:~:text=ONEKAMA%20TWP,Point%20Drive%20property%20in%20Onekama)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach Mrs. Slovik with empathy and a personal touch, possibly through a mutual community acquaintance. Recognize her family’s tenure in the area and patiently address her concerns, highlighting that the project will respect her property’s value and the community’s heritage.

neighbors.name: Tinsley James S & Kathryn M
neighbors.claims: James S. "Jim" Tinsley has been an active voice in Manistee County, authoring letters to the editor on local school funding issues and federal legislation ([www.manisteenews.com](https://www.manisteenews.com/letters-to-the-editor/article/JIM-TINSLEY-Retirement-shortfalls-shouldn-t-come-14236133.php#:~:text=In%20political%20campaigns%2C%20numbers%20always,what%20is%20relevant%20to%20me)) ([www.manisteenews.com](https://www.manisteenews.com/letters-to-the-editor/article/JIM-TINSLEY-Benishek-s-column-doesn-t-tell-whole-14222763.php#:~:text=My%20letter%20is%20in%20response,of%20the%20Manistee%20News%20Advocate)). No record was found of Tinsley holding any official position in Onekama, but his frequent public commentary suggests he is an engaged community member ([www.manisteenews.com](https://www.manisteenews.com/letters-to-the-editor/article/JIM-TINSLEY-Benishek-s-column-doesn-t-tell-whole-14222763.php#:~:text=If%20Dr,serving)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage him with data-driven explanations of how the development could boost local tax revenue (for example, funding for schools), which aligns with his focus on public funding and community benefits.

neighbors.name: Hasse Roderick L & Melissa A
neighbors.claims: Roderick and Melissa Hasse own property in Onekama Township but have maintained a low profile, with no mention of either in local news reports or civic records ([www.manisteenews.com](https://www.manisteenews.com/local-news/article/Three-candidates-vie-for-two-trustee-seats-in-15405168.php#:~:text=In%20Onekama%20Township%20voters%20will,%28Courtesy%20photo)). There is no evidence of the Hasses taking any public stance on development or participating in community meetings as of this report.

approach_recommendations.engage: Use a neighborly, informal approach to open communication, as they have not been publicly active. Listening to any concerns in a one-on-one setting may encourage them to share their thoughts.
This entity is addressed in the organizational profile; engagement strategy should follow corporate/LLC stakeholder outreach protocols.

neighbors.name: Snyder Philip C & Karen J (Le)
neighbors.claims: Philip C. Snyder and Karen J. Snyder are private landowners in Onekama Township with no public history of civic roles or statements on community projects ([www.manisteenews.com](https://www.manisteenews.com/local-news/article/Three-candidates-vie-for-two-trustee-seats-in-15405168.php#:~:text=In%20Onekama%20Township%20voters%20will,%28Courtesy%20photo)). Their property is listed under a life estate, indicating a personal estate planning arrangement; otherwise, they have not been prominent in local affairs.

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach via a trusted community intermediary or family acquaintance, emphasizing respectful communication. Given their low public profile, one-on-one conversations addressing any personal concerns would be most effective.

neighbors.name: Smeltzer David & Waters Mary
neighbors.claims: David Smeltzer manages Westwind Orchards, a fourth-generation fruit farm in Onekama Township (about 175 acres of apples and cherries) established by his family in the late 1880s ([www.masoncountypress.com](https://www.masoncountypress.com/2016/11/12/the-land-a-place-of-abundance-at-westwind-orchards/#:~:text=Arcadia%2C%20is%20orchard%20country,of%20farming%20in%20these%20parts)) ([www.masoncountypress.com](https://www.masoncountypress.com/2016/11/12/the-land-a-place-of-abundance-at-westwind-orchards/#:~:text=South%20about%2010%20miles%20from,his%20father%2C%20Percy%2C%20in%201944)). He has been a visible advocate on agricultural issues, openly discussing crop losses and supporting state assistance programs for farmers during a difficult 2012 harvest season ([www.manisteenews.com](https://www.manisteenews.com/local-news/article/Unusual-interesting-and-14235671.php#:~:text=On%20Friday%20fruit%20farmer%20David,%28Dave%20Yarnell%2FNews%20Advocate)) ([www.manisteenews.com](https://www.manisteenews.com/local-news/article/Unusual-interesting-and-14235671.php#:~:text=Smeltzer%20said%20the%20crop%20disaster,state%20will%20help%20some%20farmers)). His wife, Jennifer Smeltzer, is a well-known local figure who worked in the Michigan Legislature and even ran for a Onekama Township trustee seat in 2020, reflecting the family’s significant community engagement ([www.manisteenews.com](https://www.manisteenews.com/local-news/article/Three-candidates-vie-for-two-trustee-seats-in-15405168.php#:~:text=SMELTZER%3A%20My%20husband%20and%20I,am%20a%20graduate%20of%20the)) ([www.manisteenews.com](https://www.manisteenews.com/local-news/article/Three-candidates-vie-for-two-trustee-seats-in-15405168.php#:~:text=election%20on%20Nov,the%20township%20board%27s%20trustee%20positions)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Major orchard family; local political ties

approach_recommendations.engage: Have a respected agricultural community leader or neighbor approach the Smeltzers. Emphasize how the development can be compatible with farming and honor local heritage, which aligns with their long-term family legacy and interest in preserving farmland.

neighbors.name: Mccarthy Dennis B Trust
neighbors.influence_justification: Headed by Dennis B. McCarthy – a wealthy oil company president, former bank board chair, and active community leader

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage Dennis McCarthy directly with community-focused discussion; emphasize how the development aligns with local values and preserves Portage Lake’s integrity, given his civic involvement

neighbors.name: Agle Ardath Trust
neighbors.influence_justification: No public profile or known community roles; likely a private landowner with minimal broader influence

approach_recommendations.engage: Use a personal, low-key outreach to Ardath Agle; address any concerns about disturbance and highlight minimal impact on her property’s peace and value

neighbors.name: Kane Kevin & Eilene Trust
neighbors.influence_justification: Trustee Kevin Kane serves as Vice Chair of the Onekama Township Zoning Board of Appeals, giving him moderate sway in local land-use decisions【Onekama Township】

approach_recommendations.engage: Coordinate early with Kevin Kane given his zoning role; demonstrate the project’s compliance with local ordinances and minimal impact on nearby residences

neighbors.name: Carroll Ruth K Trust
neighbors.influence_justification: No known community positions or activities; appears to be a private landholder without broader influence

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach through respectful personal communication (likely via family or local connections); reassure that the development will not negatively affect her property or lifestyle

neighbors.name: Jfs Real Estate Group Llc
neighbors.claims: JFS Real Estate Group LLC is a property investment company that purchased a mixed-use commercial building in Onekama for $300,000 in June 2021 [Blackburne & Sons](https://www.blackburneandsons.com/trustdeeds/2788/OnekamaMIMixedUseRefinance.html). The company subsequently spent approximately $328,500 on renovations and later sought a cash-out refinance to recoup those funds [Blackburne & Sons](https://www.blackburneandsons.com/trustdeeds/2788/OnekamaMIMixedUseRefinance.html). Financial filings characterize JFS as a real estate holding company, indicating its primary focus is property investment [Blackburne & Sons](https://www.blackburneandsons.com/trustdeeds/2788/OnekamaMIMixedUseRefinance.html). The ultimate ownership of JFS is not publicly disclosed; records show a single 100% owner, suggesting a privately held venture [Blackburne & Sons](https://www.blackburneandsons.com/trustdeeds/2788/OnekamaMIMixedUseRefinance.html).
neighbors.influence_justification: Recent outside investor with limited local ties; owns property but lacks established political or social influence in Onekama

approach_recommendations.engage: Identify and engage JFS’s principal investor(s) on a business level; highlight how the project could enhance property values or offer partnership opportunities rather than competition

overview_summary: All five neighboring landowners have no documented stance on the proposed development, with each classified as "unknown" in their views. One couple (the McCormicks) appears to wield high influence locally as major landholders with a private foundation, while the others have low public profiles and limited community involvement. None of the profiled landowners have explicitly voiced support or opposition to development projects, so all five are classified with an unknown stance. One family (the Smeltzers) wields high community influence due to their longstanding agricultural legacy and civic involvement, while the others have medium to low public profiles. Four of the five neighboring landowners are family trusts tied to longtime local residents, including a prominent oil executive and a township zoning board member. These individuals likely prioritize preserving their land value and community character, indicating potential caution or opposition toward new development. The remaining neighbor is JFS Real Estate Group LLC, an outside real estate investment entity speculating on local property and primarily motivated by financial returns.
